intro: Ionopsis pusilla, commonly known as the miniature daisy or dwarf daisy, is a small flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other flowering plants. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers surrounded by narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Ionopsis pusilla is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and compact size.
